document_data.caption: A female noviere.
document_data.name: Noviere
document_data.mainbody:
'''Novieres''' were a type of [[celestial eladrin|eladrin]] that lived in the seas of [[Ossa]] in [[Arborea]]. They were also found in the realm of [[Arvandor]] and the [[Gates of the Moon]].

They were numbered among the lesser eladrin.
document_data.Description: Novieres resembled stocky but still graceful [[sea elves]] or [[nixie]]s but lacked obvious gills or webbed fingers—though both were present. They had greenish, blue, or golden skin, and their hair color ranged from dark blue-green to pale blond. Their eyes appeared to mirror the colors of the seas around them. Most novieres stood about {{SI|5|feet|c|long=yes}} tall. They glowed with a gentle light.
document_data.Personality:
Novieres took delight in the beauty of their aquatic homelands. They also loved to the explore the coastlands of other worlds to see the beauty of other places, though they traveled rarely. They were far more comfortable in the water than on land, regardless of which [[Cosmology|plane]] they were on. If away from water for too long, they began to feel ill.

They were the most social of eladrin types (excepting [[coure]]s) and were straightforward in their dealings with others. They actually preferred the company of water-dwelling mortals to that of other eladrin types. They were trusting and typically understanding of other creatures' faults and were slow to anger and slow to fight. They sought to help as many people and avoid bloodshed as much as possible.

They enjoyed trading material goods, especially [[gem]]s and jewelry.

Novieres were more intelligent than the average human. The vast majority of them were [[Chaotic good|chaotic in their mindset but good]]. It was unheard of for a noviere to be evil.
document_data.Abilities:
Novieres could swim faster than most [[human]]s could walk.

Novieres had all of the abilities common to other eladrin. In addition, they could cast many [[divine magic]] spells and had a number of other innate powers, such as the ability to [[Alter self|alter their appearance]], [[Charm person|to charm humanoids]], to [[slow]] other creatures' movements, and [[Continual light|to create continuous sources of light]], [[Silent image|silent illusions]], and [[mirror image]]s of themselves. Novieres had the supernatural power to grant other creatures the temporary ability to breathe underwater. They could use magic to hurl [[water bolt|bolts of water]], and the most powerful novieres could summon the aid of [[water elemental]]s.

Novieres were resistant to spells and attacks from mundane weapons but were weak to weapons forged from [[cold iron]], as were many [[fey]] creatures. They were immune to many mind-affecting spells.

Like all eladrin, novieres could assume an incorporeal form, theirs being the form of a {{SIAdj|7|foot|c|adj=long}} golden [[dolphin]] composed of [[water]] held together by the power of their magic. While in this form, a noviere could ram an enemy or even envelop and trap one.

Noveire eladrin could [[Comprehend languages|comprehend any language]], but they usually spoke and wrote in the Eladrin language.
document_data.Combat:
Novieres, unlike some other eladrin types, usually avoided combat. When in battle, however, they preferred weapons that were equally effective on land as under water, such as [[trident]]s, [[net]]s, or [[dagger]]s. Novieres who captured their foes in nets tried hard not to let them drown.

They used their powers of illusion to frighten away monsters from their favored coastlines.
document_data.Society:
Novieres were native to the layer of [[Aquallor]] on the plane of [[Arborea]] and were also found in the waters of the [[elven]] realm of [[Arvandor]] and the [[Gates of the Moon]]. Some novieres were also found among the [[merfolk]] and [[nereid]]s of the [[Prime Material Plane]] as visitors.

They lived in clans loosely led by a chieftain. As a race, they tended to remain separate from the other eladrin and rarely took part in the [[Court of Stars]].

Like all eladrin, novieres were sworn never to reveal their true natures to those on the Prime Material Plane.
document_data.Ecology: Novieres were not immortal, yet their lifespans were long. A typical noviere could live for nearly 500 years.
